div.div: Οἰνεύς (ϝοιν.): Oeneus, son of Portheus, king of Calydon in Aetolia, the husband of Althaea, and father of Tydeus and Meleāger, a guest-friend of Bellerophon. The Calydonian boar was sent upon his territory through the anger of Artemis, Il. 2.641, Il. 6.216, Il. 9.535, Il. 14.117.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
